A Course in Machine Learning

This book provides a gentle and pedagogically organized introduction to the field of machine learning, covering various topics such as decision trees, neural networks, probabilistic modeling, and more. It has applications in a wide range of areas, including medicine, advertising, military, and pedestrian navigation. The book aims to provide a comprehensive overview of the subject, making it an ideal resource for students and teachers.

Key Concepts:

  • Decision Trees
  • Neural Networks
  • Probabilistic Modeling
